description.db:para: This table is used by the Emergency module to store information of the organizations involved in the routing of the emergency call, this information is necessary to send the request to the VPC, according to the NENA standard. This table isn't necessary if opensips role not send request to VPC, such as the opensips acting as call server in the scenarios II and III. More information can be found at: &OPENSIPS_MOD_DOC;emergency.html.

column.name: organizationName
column.description: provider company name's. This parameter is optional field in the NENA v2 interface (call server - VPC)

column.name: hostId
column.description: provider hostname's. This parameter is mandatory if attribution is 0(source) or 2(VSP), otherwise it is optional.

column.name: nenaId
column.description: the NENA administered company identifier (NENA Company ID) of provider. This parameter is optional field in the NENA v2 interface (call server - VPC).

column.name: contact
column.description: telephone number by which the provider operator can be reached 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. This parameter is mandatory if attribution is 0(source) or 2(VSP), otherwise it is optional.

column.name: certUri
column.description: provides a means of directly obtaining the VESA(Valid Emergency Services Authority) issued certificate for the provider. This parameter is optional field in the NENA v2 interface (call server - VPC).

column.name: nodeIP
column.description: IP address of the node that is being registered. This parameter is mandatory.

column.name: attribution
column.description: It is a field of type int designating the function of the organization involved in the composition of architecture NENA being registered in this table. This parameter is mandatory. The values that this field can take are: 0 - the organization is a Source. Source is node directly requesting emergency call routing from the VPC. 1 - the organization is a VPC. VPC is the routing information provider to emengency call 2- the organization is a VSP. VSP is the caller's voice service provider
